content:
Based on the execution logs, here is the current state of the factory:

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production at (0,0) and (2,0)
Two identical smelting setups consisting of:
- Stone furnace at (0,0) producing iron plates
- Stone furnace at (2,0) producing iron plates
Both furnaces are fueled by coal and process iron ore into iron plates

### Copper Plate Production at (4,4) and (6,4)
Two identical smelting setups consisting of:
- Stone furnace at (4,4) producing copper plates
- Stone furnace at (6,4) producing copper plates
Both furnaces are fueled by coal and process copper ore into copper plates

### Power Generation System
Steam-based power generation setup:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) extracting water
- Boiler at (-2.5, 24.0) converting water to steam
- Steam engine at (4.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Connected pipe network carrying water (fluid system 1901) and steam (fluid system 1903)
- Electric pole network connecting power consumers (electricity group 1992)

### Research Facility
- Lab conducting logistics research
- Connected to the power grid via electric poles

ERROR TIPS

### Power System Maintenance
- Monitor coal levels in boiler regularly to prevent power outages
- Ensure to have coal in inventory before attempting to refuel boiler

### Production Line Management
- Check furnace ingredient levels regularly to prevent idle time
- Maintain adequate ore supplies to keep furnaces running continuously

### Research Management
- Ensure required science packs are available before starting new research
- Monitor research progress to maintain continuous research operation
- Handle "No research in progress" state appropriately when research completes

### Resource Management
- Keep track of critical resources (coal, ores) and replenish before completely depleting
- Maintain buffer stocks of key materials to prevent production interruptions
